<p><b>Notes.</b>&#160;Coordinates are in degrees WCS. The redshifts of the sources corresponding to System A, System B and System C are <i>z</i><sub>A</sub>&#160;=&#160;0.908&#160;&#177;&#160;0.005, <i>z</i><sub>B</sub>&#160;=&#160;2.06&#160;&#177;&#160;0.02 and <i>z</i><sub>C</sub>&#160;=&#160;2.59&#160;&#177;&#160;0.01, respectively (<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2011/04/aa14120-10/aa14120-10.html#R92\">Richard et&#160;al. 2010</a>).   <sup><i>&#8902;</i></sup> System D is not yet confirmed spectroscopically: for this reason, we included it as constraint only in one dedicated test. The redshift estimates for the knot groups of this system are listed in Table&#160;<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2011/04/aa14120-10/T8.html#T5\">5</a>.</p>\n            </div></div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201014120\" data-edps_ref=\"aa14120-10\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico Scaramella\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"INAF - Osservatorio Astronomico di Roma, via Frascati 33, 00044 Monte Porzio Catone, Roma, Italy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"J. Richard\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Department of Physics, Institute for Computational Cosmology, Durham University, South Road, Durham DH1 3LE, UK\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Abell\u00a0611 - II. X-ray and strong lensing analyses\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2011/03/03\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2011/04/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"528\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A73\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201014120\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2011A%26A...528A..73D\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2011/04/aa14120-10/aa14120-10.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2011/04/aa14120-10/aa14120-10.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2011/04/aa14120-10.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"X-ray: galaxies: clusters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual Abell 611\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"We present the results of our analyses of the X-ray emission and of the strong lensing systems in the galaxy cluster Abell\u00a0611 [&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a00.288]. This cluster is an optimal candidate for a comparison of the mass reconstructions obtained through X-ray and lensing techniques, because of its very relaxed dynamical appearance and its exceptional strong lensing system. We infer the X-ray mass estimate deriving the density and temperature profile of the intra-cluster medium within the radius &lt;i&gt;r&lt;i/&gt;\u00a0\u2243\u00a0700\u00a0kpc through a non-parametric approach, taking advantage of the high spatial resolution of a &lt;i&gt;Chandra &lt;i/&gt;observation. Assuming that the cluster is in hydrostatic equilibrium and adopting a matter density profile, we can recover the total mass distribution of Abell\u00a0611 via the X-ray data. Moreover, we derive the total projected mass in the central regions of Abell\u00a0611 performing a parametric analysis of its strong lensing features through the publicly available analysis software &lt;i&gt;Lenstool&lt;i/&gt;. As a final step we compare the results obtained with both methods. We derive a good agreement between the X-ray and strong lensing total mass estimates in the central regions where the strong lensing constraints are present (i.e. within the radius &lt;i&gt;r&lt;i/&gt;\u00a0\u2243\u00a0100\u00a0kpc), while a marginal disagreement is found between the two mass estimates when extrapolating the strong lensing results in the outer spatial range. We suggest that in this case the X-ray/strong lensing mass disagreement can be explained by an incorrect estimate of the relative contributions of the baryonic component and of the dark matter, caused by the intrinsic degeneracy between the different mass components in the strong lensing analysis. We discuss the effect of some possible systematic errors that influence both mass estimates. We find a slight dependence of the measurements of the X-ray temperatures (and therefore of the X-ray total masses) on the background adopted in the spectral analysis, with total deviations on the value of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200&lt;sub/&gt; of the order of the 1&lt;i&gt;\u03c3&lt;i/&gt; statistical error. The strong lensing mass results are instead sensitive to the parameterisation of the galactic halo mass in the central regions, in particular to the modelling of the brightest cluster galaxy (BCG) baryonic component, which induces a significant scatter in the strong lensing mass results.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=S. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n </td>\n              </tr>\n              <tr>\n                <td align=\"left\"> BCG<sub>Sersic</sub></td>\n                <td align=\"center\">(0.0)</td>\n                <td align=\"center\">(0.0)</td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"><span class=\"img-inline\"><img align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\">S&#233;rsic index <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2011/04/aa14120-10/aa14120-10-eq308.png\" /></span></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n              </tr>\n              <tr>\n                <td colspan=\"11\" align=\"left\">\n                  <hr />\n                </td>\n              </tr>\n              <tr>\n                <td align=\"left\"> Perturber 1</td>\n                <td align=\"center\">(2.33)</td>\n                <td align=\"center\">(&#8722;7.85)</td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\">21.8<span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2011/04/aa14120-10/aa14120-10-eq309.png\" /></span></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\">176.0<span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2011/04/aa14120-10/aa14120-10-eq310.png\" /></span></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n              </tr>\n              <tr>\n                <td align=\"left\"> Ref. Galaxy</td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\">36.5<span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2011/04/aa14120-10/aa14120-10-eq311.png\" /></span></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\">161.7<span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2011/04/aa14120-10/aa14120-10-eq312.png\" /></span></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n                <td align=\"center\"></td>\n              </tr>\n            </table></div><div class=\"history\">\n              <p><b>Notes.</b>&#160;The results are derived assuming an elliptical NFW profile for the cluster-scale lens component and an elliptical dPIE for the galaxy scale halos. We report only the values that were optimised in the strong lensing fit; additionally, the coordinates of the cluster galaxies are listed in round brackets for the sake of clarity, but they were not optimised. The columns list the coordinates of the halo centroid (expressed in arcseconds with respect to the BCG centre: at the cluster redshift and for the assumed cosmology, 1 arcsec&#8201;=&#8201;4.329&#160;kpc), the potential ellipticity (here expressed as <i>e</i>&#160;=&#160;(<i>a</i><sup>2</sup>&#160;&#8722;&#160;<i>b</i><sup>2</sup>)/(<i>a</i><sup>2</sup>&#160;+&#160;<i>b</i><sup>2</sup>)), the halo position angle, the scale radius <i>r</i><sub>&#160;<i>&#8902;</i>&#160;</sub> (that indicates the scale radius <i>r</i><sub>s</sub> for the cluster-scale NFW halo and the truncation radius <i>r</i><sub>cut</sub> for the galaxy-scale dPIE halos), the concentration parameter <i>c</i><sub>200</sub>, the total mass <i>M</i><sub>200</sub>, the characteristic velocity dispersion <i>&#963;</i><sub>0</sub> for the NFW or the dPIE profiles, expressed in km&#160;&#160;s<sup>-1</sup>, the reduced <i>&#967;</i><sup>2</sup> (the number of degrees of freedom is enclosed within square brackets) and the root-mean-square computed in the image plane (rms<sub>i</sub>). The uncertainties represent the 68% statistical errors, derived assuming a Gaussian probability distribution. If the upper and lower errors are significantly asymmetric we report both of them. For a description of the cases listed here, see Pag.&#160;. </p>\n            </div></div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201014120\" data-edps_ref=\"aa14120-10\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico ico-info\"></span>\n\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t<p>Initial download of the metrics may take a while.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\" src=\"/templates/source/js/metrics-tab.js\"></script>\n\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\n                                                    </div>\n                        <nav class=\"article\">\n Richard\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Department of Physics, Institute for Computational Cosmology, Durham University, South Road, Durham DH1 3LE, UK\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Abell\u00a0611 - II. X-ray and strong lensing analyses\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2011/03/03\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2011/04/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"528\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A73\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201014120\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2011A%26A...528A..73D\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2011/04/aa14120-10/aa14120-10.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2011/04/aa14120-10/aa14120-10.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2011/04/aa14120-10.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"X-ray: galaxies: clusters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual Abell 611\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"We present the results of our analyses of the X-ray emission and of the strong lensing systems in the galaxy cluster Abell\u00a0611 [&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a00.288]. This cluster is an optimal candidate for a comparison of the mass reconstructions obtained through X-ray and lensing techniques, because of its very relaxed dynamical appearance and its exceptional strong lensing system. We infer the X-ray mass estimate deriving the density and temperature profile of the intra-cluster medium within the radius &lt;i&gt;r&lt;i/&gt;\u00a0\u2243\u00a0700\u00a0kpc through a non-parametric approach, taking advantage of the high spatial resolution of a &lt;i&gt;Chandra &lt;i/&gt;observation. Assuming that the cluster is in hydrostatic equilibrium and adopting a matter density profile, we can recover the total mass distribution of Abell\u00a0611 via the X-ray data. Moreover, we derive the total projected mass in the central regions of Abell\u00a0611 performing a parametric analysis of its strong lensing features through the publicly available analysis software &lt;i&gt;Lenstool&lt;i/&gt;. As a final step we compare the results obtained with both methods. We derive a good agreement between the X-ray and strong lensing total mass estimates in the central regions where the strong lensing constraints are present (i.e. within the radius &lt;i&gt;r&lt;i/&gt;\u00a0\u2243\u00a0100\u00a0kpc), while a marginal disagreement is found between the two mass estimates when extrapolating the strong lensing results in the outer spatial range. We suggest that in this case the X-ray/strong lensing mass disagreement can be explained by an incorrect estimate of the relative contributions of the baryonic component and of the dark matter, caused by the intrinsic degeneracy between the different mass components in the strong lensing analysis. We discuss the effect of some possible systematic errors that influence both mass estimates. We find a slight dependence of the measurements of the X-ray temperatures (and therefore of the X-ray total masses) on the background adopted in the spectral analysis, with total deviations on the value of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200&lt;sub/&gt; of the order of the 1&lt;i&gt;\u03c3&lt;i/&gt; statistical error. The strong lensing mass results are instead sensitive to the parameterisation of the galactic halo mass in the central regions, in particular to the modelling of the brightest cluster galaxy (BCG) baryonic component, which induces a significant scatter in the strong lensing mass results.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=S. method=\"post\">\n            <div class=\"wrap\">\n            <div class=\"inputs\">\n                <input type=\"text\" name=\"q\" />\n                <button type=\"submit\" value=\"search\">\n                    <span class=\"ico ico-search\" title=\"Search\"></span>\n                </button>\n            </div> \n                            <div class=\"s_volume_page\">\n                    <a href=\"/component/searcharticle/?by=vol-page\">Access by volume/page</a>\n                </div>\n                        </div>\n\n            <div class=\"advanced\"><a href=\"/component/solr/\">Advanced Search</a></div>\n        </form>\n    </div>\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\">\n\tjQuery(function ($) {\n\t    var source = function (request, callback) {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div class=\"wrap\">                                  </div>                  \n              </div>\n                    </header>\n\n        <main class=\"aa\" id=\"main\">\n\n            <!--div class=\"wrap\">\n             <p>Message placeholder</p>\n            </div-->\n\n            \n            \n              \n              \n            \n            \n            <div class=\"wrap\" >\n                              \n<div class=\"breadcrumbs\">\n\n\n\n<a href=\"/\" class=\"pathway\">Home</a> <img src=\"/media/system/images/arrow.png\" alt=\"\"  /> <a (2011) A73</a> <img src=\"/media/system/images/arrow.png\" alt=\"\"  /> <span>Full HTML</span></div>\n\n              \n                                                    <div id=\"content\" [61]</td>\n                <td align=\"center\">0.079</td>\n                <td align=\"center\">0.33 </td>\n              </tr>\n            </table></div><div class=\"history\">\n              <p><b>Notes.</b>&#160;We show here the goodness-of-fit indicators for a representative case (case 1 in Table&#160;<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2011/04/aa14120-10/T6.html#T5\">5</a>). The columns list the knots system ID, the total <i>&#967;</i><sup>2</sup> for the system, the root-mean-square computed in the source plane (rms<sub>s</sub>), and in the image plane (rms<sub>i</sub>). The last row reports the total <i>&#967;</i><sup>2</sup> estimator, referring to a model with 61 degrees of freedom.</p>\n            </div></div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201014120\" data-edps_ref=\"aa14120-10\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico ico-info\"></span>\n\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t<p>Initial download of the metrics may take a while.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\"
